definition: to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions
to break even/balance between income and expenditure

sentences.english: Verifying the comprehensiveness and timeliness of the data in foreign-related revenue and expenditure declaration.
sentences.chinese: 核查涉外收支申报数据全面性和及时性。

sentences.english: They often find stories by looking at changes in income or spending from year to year.
sentences.chinese: 他们经常可以通过查看历年的收支变化而发现新闻。

sentences.english: We should not compare with the higher. Otherwise, we won't make both ends meet.
sentences.chinese: 我们不应与人攀比，否则就无法收支相抵。

sentences.english: The accounts show a favourable balance of 150 yuan.
I plan to quit drinking, smoking and gambling so that I can make ends meet.
sentences.chinese: 我准备戒烟戒酒戒赌，以达到收支平衡。
第四步，确定收支平衡点。

sentences.english: Paying its debts defunded the firm's operating budget.
sentences.chinese: 还债耗尽了该公司的营业收支预算。

sentences.english: It was my hope that we could balance the budget before the year is out.
sentences.chinese: 岁末前，我们能够作到收支平衡。

sentences.english: We have to cut our expe es to make both ends meet.
sentences.chinese: 我们要削减开支，使收支平衡。

sentences.english: Follow these five steps for figuring out your break-even point.
sentences.chinese: 按照下面五个步骤你就可以找到你的收支平衡点。

sentences.english: Do you know how to compute the financial “break-even point” for your
sentences.chinese: 你会计算公司财务的收支平衡点吗？

sentences.english: If you don't know your break-even point, you're running your business blindly.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不知道收支平衡点，你就是在盲目经营。

sentences.english: Figure out a reasonable time frame to the breakeven point.
sentences.chinese: 给收支平衡点计算出一个合理的时间表。

sentences.english: He uses his ingenuity as best he can to make ends meet.
sentences.chinese: 他用尽各种巧妙办法使收支两抵。

sentences.english: Chinese cities make ends meet through land-grabs.
sentences.chinese: 中国城市通过贩卖土地达到收支平衡。

sentences.english: After six months of trading the company broke even.
sentences.chinese: 在经营了六个月后，公司已收支相抵。

definition: expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
income does not cover expenditure/unable to make ends meet
to break even/balance between income and expenditure
final account/to calculate the final bill/fig. to draw up plans to deal with sth
